intro: Cirsium spicatum, commonly known as thistle bluemink, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features spiny leaves and produces purple to blue flower heads that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky slopes. Cirsium spicatum is often considered a weed in agricultural settings due to its aggressive growth and persistent seeds.
